title: The first cases
content: President Joko Widodo announced two first positive cases in Indonesia

title: Expanded international travel ban
content: Travel restrictions expanded to include several cities in South Korea, Italy and Iran. Visitors from these countries must provide a valid health certificate.

title: Treatment facilities
content: The government designated 132 treatment facilities across Indonesia

title: Activities began to be restricted
content: Following to President Joko Widodo call on social distancing, major Jakarta companies started conducting work from home policy [1]. Several regions closed schools and imposed learning activity from home [2]. MUI issued a fatwa to forbid non-compulsory worships in mosque during pandemic [3]. On 17 March, COVID-19 health protocols have been released to public [4].

title: Kemayoran Athletes Village
content: Kemayoran Athletes Village was officially converted to house COVID-19 patients with mild symptoms. This site claimed to be able to house up to 1800 patients.

title: Not yet lockdown for Jakarta
content: President Joko Widodo refused to impose lockdown on Jakarta.  Bus routes connecting Jakarta and other cities and provinces will remain open following the cancellation of a plan to temporarily suspend operations of AKAP buses.

title: Temporary entry ban for all foreign citizens
content: The Directorate General of Immigration in Indonesia temporarily ban entry to the Republic of Indonesia for foreign citizens with several exceptions.

title: Large-scale Social Restrictions (PSBB)
content: The government of DKI Jakarta imposed large-scale social restrictions, followed by several other regions like Bogor, Depok, Bekasi and Tangerang.

title: COVID-19 is a national disaster
content: President Joko Widodo declared COVID-19 as a national disaster after it has infected 4557 people and caused 399 deaths in Indonesia.

title: Mudik Idul Fitri is banned
content: President Joko Widodo announced his decision to ban Idul Fitri mudik (exodus) starting from 24 April to limit the spread of COVID-19 [1]. To help with this effort, several long distance transportations were banned until at least 31 May [2].

title: Regional elections are postponed
content: President issued a regulation to postpone 2020 regional elections until December with a potential to prolong the postponement should the national disaster persist.

title: Public transportations are allowed to operate but not for 'mudik'
content: Transportation Minister said that it was possible for the government to allow all means of public transportation to start operations on 7 May to accommodate particular individuals while insisting on banning this yearâ€™s Idul Fitri mudik.

title: Government tightened security at 'mudik' ban checkpoints
content: The government began to tighten its monitoring of the mudik ban as the Idul Fitri holiday on 24-25 May was approaching. Violators would either be stopped or turned back.

title: Religious activities on public are starting to return
content: Using SE 15/2020, the Minister of Religious Affairs allows houses of worship to reopen if it is deemed safe by its respective regional head of COVID-19 Task Force and as long as they implement a strict health and hygiene protocol.

title: PSBB begins to relax
content: Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan has issued Pergub No. 51/2020 on the implementation of relaxing PSBB (transitional PSBB). The document lists various regulations in place during transitional PSBB period, such as allowing business to operate with 50% presence.

title: Ojek to return operating
content: The Ministry of Transportation has issued regulation Permenhub No. 41/2020 to relax the various restrictions placed by the previous regulation (Permenhub No. 18/2020). The relaxations include allowing motorcycle taxi services (ojek) to continue operating again and increase the maximum capacity of flight passengers to 70%.

title: Working hour is adjusted for 'new normal' period
content: National Covid-19 Task Force publishes a circular No. 8 2020 to regulate working shifts for companies within Jabodetabek region in effort to reducing the potential of crowd arising in public transportations during peak hours.

title: New health protocol is published
content: Ministry of Health releases a new health protocol to support people's activity in public without creating new cluster during pandemic period.
